results.title: Physical growth and motor development
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Human development: the first 2 1/2 years”.
Emphasises individual differences by depicting a wide range of normal physical growth and motor development. Discusses ways in which environmental factors such as nutrition and the mother’s health habits during pregnancy affect development. Traces developmental patterns and norms by examining the role of crawling in simultaneously developing both parts of the brain and the sequences of development across cultures and between genders.

results.title: Physical growth and motor development
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Human development: 2 1/2 to 6 years”.
Between the ages of 2-6, two major developments occur. Children learn to co-ordinate their body movements and to function independently in basic living skills such as eating and dressing. Physiological development displays a greater spectrum of individuality but generally the stomach doubles in size, although appetite is often reduced, the brain grows and the immune system develops. Muscle strength is related to maturation, however at this stage there is minimal difference between genders in motor performance. In this stage of development, children learn to explore concepts such as depth, size, height and develop spatial awareness.

results.title: Physical fitness and good health
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions, Ken Peterson and Les Clark
results.brief_description: Uses animation to hows how exercise helps build muscle tissue and increase the capillaries’ capacity to supply blood to body parts; presents live action sequences of animals to show that rest is essential to all forms of animal life; discusses the importance of a proper diet for physical fitness and good health.

results.title: Physical fitness (Captioned)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Fun to Be Fit Series”.
Animation and the singing of lighthearted lyrics contrasts the lack of physical activity since machinery has become such a large part of modern life, against the amount of physical activity that was necessary before the event of such machinery. “We have a different style. But we don’t get enough exercise” are part of the lyrics which introduce this program. However, the video ends on a positive and hopeful note, as mankind is re-educated in the improvements possible to ensure health, happiness and quality of life by increasing daily physical activities.

results.title: Physical facilities
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Industrial Management”.
Describes the steps in organising physical facilities of a new enterprise: 1) location from the aspect of available facilities; 2) type of building suited to the enterprise; 3) the arrangement and position of the buildings; 4) plant layout from the aspect of type production.

results.title: Physical examination
results.brief_description: A physical examination need not be a mysterious and fearful experience of young children. This film prepares the child by explaining the process, step-by-step, in a gently humorous way. Parents and medical personnel also learn how to describe examination procedures to children so that their fears and anxieties are minimized.

results.title: Physical education: children aged 4 to 6 years
results.brief_description: This documentary runs through the set guidelines established by the Board of Education work schedule for infants’ first school year. Instructed in the development through free activity, independent action self control, lightens, flexibility and alertness. Based on he Board of Eduction syllabus of physical education for school, 1933.

results.title: Physical education for children
results.creator_credit: Faculty of Education and Glenn Kirchner
results.brief_description: Shows how the basic needs and interests of primary school age children are translated into a physical education program, The nature and role of intramural activities and programs for exceptional children are also covered.
